meanings.definition: Having knurls or knobs; gnarled or twisted.
meanings.sent1: The old tree had knurlier branches than the young sapling.
meanings.sent2: The knurlier roots of the ancient oak tree spread far and wide.
meanings.sent3: The knurlier branches of the tree looked like twisted ropes in the wind.
meanings.sent4: His knurlier fingers moved deftly over the rough surface of the sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The knurlier bark of the tree felt like rough sandpaper to the touch.

meanings.sent1: The knurlier path led deeper into the dense forest.
meanings.sent2: As the storm passed, the sky became knurlier with dark clouds.
meanings.sent3: The knurlier the branches, the more squirrels seemed to gather on them.
meanings.sent4: Her knurlier hair tangled easily in the strong wind.
meanings.sent5: The knurlier the rope, the harder it was to untangle.
